entry.title: glitter (stuck to me like the sky and stars)
entry.summary:
Author: AsperJasper

Rating: Teen And Up AudiencesLanguage: EnglishWords: 11,951Chapters: 1/3Kudos: 6

Summary: Eddie is worried about Buck. Which isn‚Äôt, all things considered, that unusual, since Buck is very good at not telling anybody when he‚Äôs not doing well, and is also the most likely person to run into an unsafe situation headfirst of anybody Eddie has ever met, and he‚Äôs including himself in that. This is a different kind of worried, though. Physically, he knows Buck is fine. Their last few shifts have been the word that Eddie isn‚Äôt allowed to say out loud, Buck‚Äôs leg hasn‚Äôt bothered him in months, everything should be fine. Eddie is pretty sure, though, that something is going on, anyway. Buck‚Äôs been weird, and not in the endearing, kind of awkwardly charming way he always is. He‚Äôs been dodging plans, giving vague and sometimes unbelievable excuses. Showing up to planned breakfasts and lunches exhausted, even sometimes walking in late to a shift, which is just unlike Buck. So Eddie is worried about him.or, the one where Buck is an amateur drag queen, Eddie finds out, and isn't that interesting for Eddie Diaz?

Summary: ‚ÄúMan‚Äî‚Äù Buck slams the can of pineapple down on the counter, maybe a bit harder than he‚Äôd intended. ‚ÄúCan I be honest for a second?‚Äù Eddie raises an eyebrow and pauses his shredding, looking over at Buck. ‚Äú...yeah?‚Äù It comes out like it‚Äôs a question, as if he‚Äôs not really sure he wants to know what the other man‚Äôs about to say. Buck looks Eddie directly in the eyes as he says, ‚ÄúI fucking hate your parents.‚Äù Eddie‚Äôs eyes crinkle slightly, and he presses his lips together in an obvious attempt to suppress a smile as he returns his attention to shredding the last bit of zucchini. ‚ÄúYeah, well, I fucking hate your parents, too.‚Äù or; Buck helps Eddie make zucchini bread for a surprise brunch with his parents.
